Title:
Four Eyes Are Better Than Two: On
the Impact of Code Reviews on Software Quality
Elements_risk_assessment: starting from the revision rel-fix i,k âˆ’ 1, for each source line in f i changed to fix the bug k the blame feature of Git is used to identify the file revision where the last change to that line occurred.
UseOF-SZZ: to determine commits that induce bugfixes
Summary:
exploratory study on three large open source systems that aims at investigating the influence of code review on (i) the chances of inducing bug fixes and (ii)
the quality of the committed code components, as assessed by code coupling, complexity, and readability.
Outcome:
unreviewed commits have over two times more
chances of introducing bugs than reviewed commits
